intro: Cracca wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan cracca, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The plant is characterized by its upright, slender stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Cracca wallichii is often found in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions.
